meanings.definition: To establish a new base for something.
meanings.sent1: I will rebase the plant in a bigger pot to help it grow better.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to rebase their operations in a different city.
meanings.sent3: After the flood, they had to rebase the entire house on higher ground.
meanings.sent4: She had to rebase her expectations after realizing the original plan was not feasible.
meanings.sent5: The decision to rebase the project led to greater success in the long run.

meanings.definition: To adjust the base value of a currency.
meanings.sent1: The government chose to rebase the currency to stabilize the economy.
meanings.sent2: Investors were concerned about the decision to rebase the national currency.
meanings.sent3: The sudden decision to rebase the currency left many people confused.
meanings.sent4: Rebasing the currency was a bold move to combat inflation.
meanings.sent5: The decision to rebase the currency had a significant impact on international trade.

meanings.definition: To change the base point of a scale or index.
meanings.sent1: The scientist had to rebase the temperature scale for accurate readings.
meanings.sent2: It was necessary to rebase the stock index due to market fluctuations.
meanings.sent3: The decision to rebase the grading system caused quite a stir among students.
meanings.sent4: Rebasing the interest rate was crucial for economic stability.
meanings.sent5: The decision to rebase the index led to more reliable data analysis.
